intro: Saurauia yasicae, commonly known as the Yasicae stonecrop, is a rare and endemic species native to the mountainous regions of Taiwan. It belongs to the family Crassulaceae, characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and compact growth habit. The plant typically grows in rocky or crevice habitats, showcasing its adaptation to harsh, high-altitude environments. Its small, star-shaped flowers are usually white or pale pink, blooming in late spring to early summer. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Saurauia yasicae is considered a vulnerable species, highlighting the importance of conservation efforts in its native range.
